intro: Urostigma biverrucellum, commonly known as the rough bladderpod, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces elongated, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, it thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in dryland ecosystems.
